gov.nih.nlm.ling.transform

Class ModifierCoordinationCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.transform.ModifierCoordinationCorrection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DependencyTransformation

    public class ModifierCoordinationCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
implements DependencyTransformation
    A DependencyTransformation implementation that attempts to fix problems with modifier coordination-related dependencies, which are often misidentified by the Stanford Parser.

    This transformation does not have any prerequisites.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Method Detail

      • getPrerequisites

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends DependencyTransformation>> getPrerequisites()
        Description copied from interface: DependencyTransformation
        Gets the dependency transformation rules that should have been applied before applying the current one.

        This is because the current rule assumes a dependency configuration generated by the prerequisite rule.

        Specified by:
        getPrerequisites in interface DependencyTransformation
        Returns:
        the prerequisite dependency transformation rules, or empty list if no prerequisites

      • getNpInternalDependencies

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNpInternalDependencies()

      • transform

        public void transform(Sentence sent)
        Transforms a sentence by rearranging the dependencies involved in modifier coordination.

        It requires that both modifiers in consideration have semantic objects of the same class, i.e, both predicates or entities. For example, dependencies for adenylate cyclase and p70(S6)-kinase activation are re-arranged as follows:

        • conj and(adenylate cyclase,activation), amod(activation,p70(S6)-kinase) to
        • amod(activation,and), cc(and,adenylate cyclase), cc(and,p70(S6)-kinase)
        It checks npInternalDependencies member variable for the list of NP-internal dependencies to use. If null, it uses the default list defined in SynDependency.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface DependencyTransformation
        Parameters:
        sent - the sentence to transform
